law.catch_line: Tampering with a prisoner monitoring device.

text.section: A person is guilty of tampering with a prisoner monitoring device when he or she intentionally alters, disables, deactivates, tampers with, removes, damages, or destroys any device used to facilitate electronic monitoring or supervision of a person who is on probation or parole, or has been ordered to wear a device as a condition of pretrial release.
Tampering with a prisoner monitoring device is a Class D felony.

law.history: Created 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 182, sec. 36, effective July 12, 2006.
